Hi David,

Published by JSSUS, and yes, the translation was done a long time ago.
Kichijitsu = auspicious day as in sword signatures.

Gordon
  -----Original Message-----
  From: David Zincavage [mailto:jdz@...]
  Sent: Tuesday, July 01, 2003 8:27 AM
  To: token_kenkyu_kai@...; nihonto@...;
nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
  Subject: [nihontostudy] Hizen Handbook


  My copy of Mr. Robson translation of Eguchi's Hizento Hikkei arrived today
  from Mr. Watson.  I find it necessary to keep a list of the titles I own
  (senility) to keep from ordering duplicates, and when I was entering this
  book on my list, I found no publisher, place, or date of publication
listed.

  My impression is that the JSS/US was the publisher, is that correct?  Mr.
  Robson refers to "an auspicious day" in 1997.  This just appeared, did it
  not?

  What, by the way, is the Japanese for "auspicious day?"
